Definition: In this task, you will be given a text. You must determine if the text is about a person. If the text is about a person, output "Yes". If the text is not about a person, output "No". "Yes" or "No" are the only outputs. The text does not have to mention a person for the text to be about a person.

Positive Examples.input: Text:  The third and current HMS Argyll is a Type 23 'Duke' Class frigate. She is currently the oldest serving Type 23 frigate in the Royal Navy. Like all of her class she is named for a British dukedom in this case that of Argyll.
Positive Examples.explanation: HMS Argyll is a frigate which a warship. Clearly the text is not about a person. Hence, the answer is No.

Positive Examples.input: Text: Alison Bechdel (/ˈbɛkdəl/ BEK-dəl; born September 10 1960) is an American cartoonist. Originally best known for the long-running comic strip Dykes to Watch Out For she came to critical and commercial success in 2006 with her graphic memoir Fun Home.
Positive Examples.explanation: Alison Bechdel is an American cartoonist. Clearly the text is about a person. The answer should be Yes.

Negative Examples.input: Text:  The third and current HMS Argyll is a Type 23 'Duke' Class frigate. She is currently the oldest serving Type 23 frigate in the Royal Navy. Like all of her class she is named for a British dukedom in this case that of Argyll.
Negative Examples.explanation: HMS Argyll is a frigate which a warship. Clearly the text is not about a person. Hence, it is an incorrect answer and a negative example.

Negative Examples.input: Text: Alison Bechdel (/ˈbɛkdəl/ BEK-dəl; born September 10 1960) is an American cartoonist. Originally best known for the long-running comic strip Dykes to Watch Out For she came to critical and commercial success in 2006 with her graphic memoir Fun Home.
Negative Examples.explanation: The output is neither "Yes" nor "No". Hence, it is an incorrect answer and a negative example.

Instances.input: Text:  Thomas J. Burch (born July 19 1931) is an American politician in the state of Kentucky.Burch born in Louisville attended Bellarmine College graduating in 1959 in business. He served in the United States Navy and United States Naval Reserve from 1948 to 1956 and also worked for General Electric from 1953 to 1991 as a production control manager. He was elected to the Kentucky House of Representatives initially in 1972 serving a single term until 1975.

Text:  Virginia is a wooden schooner that is a modern replica of an early twentieth century pilot vessel of the same name. She conducts educational programs and passenger trips along the Eastern Seaboard of the United States and Canada and in the Caribbean.
Text:  Johan Hammar (born 22 February 1994) is a Swedish professional footballer currently playing for Malmö FF in Allsvenskan as a defender.

Text:  LeGarrette Montez Blount (born December 5 1986) is an American football running back for the Pittsburgh Steelers of the National Football League (NFL). He was signed by the Tennessee Titans as an undrafted free agent in 2010. He has also been a member of the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and New England Patriots.Blount rushed for over 1000 yards in each of his two seasons in junior college. He then committed to the Oregon Ducks football program as a junior for the 2008 season.

Text:  Deathbird Stories: A Pantheon of Modern Gods is a 1975 collection of short stories written by Harlan Ellison over a period of ten years; the stories address the theme of modern-day deities that have replaced the older more traditional ones. The collection with its satirical skeptical tone is widely considered one of Ellison's best. The book includes a 1973 introduction and a stern caveat lector page advising the reader against enjoying the volume in one sitting.

Text:  Humbug was a humor magazine edited 1957–1958 by Harvey Kurtzman with satirical jabs at movies television advertising and various artifacts of popular culture from cereal boxes to fashion photographs. Nine of the eleven issues were published in a black-and-white comic book-sized format.With fatally accurate irony Kurtzman delivered his declaration of editorial principles in the first issue:We won't write for morons. We won't do anything just to get laughs. We won't be dirty.
Text:  Eupithecia curvifascia is a moth in the Geometridae family. It is found on Jamaica.

Text:  Kristína Kučová (born 23 May 1990 in Bratislava) is a Slovak tennis player. Her highest juniors ranking was world number three. According to the International Tennis Federation Kučová's favorite type of court is the clay court she hits a two-handed forehand and backhand (like Grand Slam champions Monica Seles and Marion Bartoli) and her father Jozef Kuča also coaches her.
